thread.title: Pallbearer’s “Thorns” Is as Bright Metal Gets
thread.title_full: Pallbearer’s “Thorns” Is as Bright Metal Gets

author: Colin Joyce
title: Pallbearer’s “Thorns” Is as Bright Metal Gets
text:
Pallbearer “Thorns” 
The Arkansas quartet Pallbearer pushes at the rigid strictures of doom metal with warped rhythms and cosmically dense songs. On “Thorns,” the lead single from their third full-length album, Heartless , they trade in gloom for heavy, memorable hooks. Creeping, downtuned chords—a constant of the band—pair with guitar work that’s more meticulous and flashy than before. Delicate leads shimmer and spark; ornate guitars unfurl majestically, like a medieval tapestry. Their music retains that same crushing weight, but on “Thorns,” they’ve dipped their harrowing harmonies in gold.
